title: Frequently Hated Champions
body:
{{champion:7}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:157}}

What part of kit design do these ALL have in common?

HINT: It's on the checklist for all of Riot's new champions.

replies.body: They can't use some part of their kit while rooted
lol
Good luck rooting them though, unless you're playing {{champion:13}} expect dodges for days.

Actually;

{{champion:7}}'s passive still works, and if she is unrooted then things might get messy.

{{champion:429}} can still throw spears, use her Q, use her W, use her E, and also her R... because they don't displace her movement unless you click to move.

{{champion:238}} can still use his W (to even get out a snare I think), use his Q, use his E, but I don't know about the R.

{{champion:245}} can still use his Q and his W. 

I'm not sure but I think {{champion:64}} can use his Q (part 1), but other than that...

{{champion:76}} can still throw spears, use her Q, use her W, and her E.

{{champion:157}} can use his Q and his W.

but, then again it all depends. I think snares should stop more than just movement, they should also silence a champion if caught for 3/4 the time they are snared, unless its Lux or Morgana, that can be just 1/2 of the time.

Imagine if:

{{champion:32}} doesn't get a silence, btw since he already has a stun in his kit.

{{champion:51}} has a snare to help her when enemies get caught in her traps. Her traps will more than likely be like Teemo's shrooms and have a limit to how many she can carry.

{{champion:60}}'s E will have a silence for just a few seconds to allow a better assassination.

{{champion:222}}'s E will not have a silence... unless we up the mana and lower the damage. Sorry but its not that desperate.

{{champion:43}} should get a silence for half her snare on normal W, and do 3/4 of the snare when with R.

{{champion:38}}'s E should do a silence, since it was OP on his Q, waiting 6 spells for a poke with a silence would be fun. (If you don't like it, please comment bellow your reasons.)

{{champion:7}}'s at a point where she doesn't need a silence with her power.

{{champion:99}} will just have a 1/2 the time limit silence.

{{champion:25}} as well.

{{champion:107}} will have a 1/4 the time silence, and on full 5 stacks will do a 1/2 silence.

{{champion:13}} will not have a silence.

{{champion:16}}'s silence will last through the snare. Or at least 3/4s of it.

{{champion:50}}'s will be 1/2.

{{champion:412}} no silence.

{{champion:110}} full silence on the first target, and 3/4 silence for the duration of each other snare on his R.

{{champion:143}} will have a 3/4 second silence.

We won't know until someone tests this.
FYI, he said "some part of their kit".

i hate these champions beyond anything rational. these champions give me every disease in the damn universe. id rather suck 500dicks than play vs a nasus or trynd. so stupidly designed .
hey... i main nasus

Every action has an equal and opposite reaction. When you giggle with glee as you chunk a turret for half its health with one auto, someone else somewhere in the universe has a heart attack. I hope you're pleased with yourself.

He's not a Leblanc with insane kill potential, sure he's tough but unless you've got 700 stacks u cant 1v5
Also, yes I enjoy being a tank, I don't like playing as squishies.
If every action has an equal and opposite reaction; then while a lane bully such as{{champion:58}} or {{champion:150}} is stomping on me, I am growling in frustration as I stack upon minions.
Stacking is immensely easier than it sounds. 700 by 35 minutes is not uncommon, even if they take a break.
You would have to literally AFK farm up until that point. Possibly even not go back, or go back and then TP right back to your lane for the next minion wave.

But then you realize that afk farming nasus has taken the entirety of top lane, is 1v2ing like a giggling school girl, and is now making his way down to bot lane. What a beast.

Seemed necessary: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jbp52Z9jRg0

At that point it's not about winning, it's about the enemy team losing. I've had a lot of games with an AFK Nasus Farmer. Typically we abuse that. 4v5 at every moment, win, and then shove objectives and towers so hard that we're at their inhib before Nasus hits 300 stacks. 

The goal of that game is to abuse the Afk Nasus and just win before he has his stacks. So the only way to cheese a Nasus victory like that is to get stuck with a bronze 5 enemy team that won't take advantage of your lack of presence.

while I know it isn't accurate for a real game in any way whatsoever, I once played a custom as nasus to see how quickly I could stack under the most ideal circumstances.

1000 stacks before 20 minutes

...
I never realized Nasus was capable of something like that.
i know right?  i knew that it could be done pretty fast, but thats rediculous.
URF Nasus is beast. 1000 by 15.
how do u sleep at night.
The cycle of life and death continues.  We shall Q, they shall QQ.

Yas has no meaningful cooldowns (highest one at 40% cdr and lvl 16 is his ulti. 17 seconds. Thats a joke, right riot?) which is what bothers me. Kalista.... not even going to get started. I'm glad she is squishy, but utterly pissed that if I can't kill her with my one/two gap closers...well then I'm just dead. No window of weakness on this champion. =/ Excuse me while I learn how to main Annie to shut down all these hyper mobility champs XD.

I though riot's balance idea was that resourceless champs (Flow isn't a resource for anything but that fucking shield) were meant to have high CD's to compensate, what was that {{champion:92}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:23}} (rage isn't spent on abilities)

Trade-off is supposedly high cooldowns which makes cdr necessary (see riven) or low damage per ability (see Katarina and Yasuo). However.... spammable, low damage with next to no repercussion sounds a bit....yea....
I assumed that it was supposed to be high cooldowns even WITH CDR

cuz everyone has full rune pages, an extensive knowledge of every champ in the game, a mobile champion(the most expensive other than yi) to counterplay them, a mobile champion that doesn't require playing in the jungle role, a mobile champion with enough poke damage to counter their intargetable states  (fought a zed today while playing as tanky nasus...he did 3k damage in under 2 seconds and yes, I had armor to counter his damage...he wasn't even fed)

yasuo can kill just about anyone early and late game other than xerath/ziggs or other characters with artillery mechanics(isn't that less than 10 champs...)  xerath, ziggs, urgot  (actually, I don't even know if that works because his E moves towards them *shrug*), brand, and i can't think of anyone else


I take more offense though to when riot's OP servers give me "attempting to reconnect" for 30 minutes of the game while nothing is using internet

if this wasn't one of the only fun free games, i'd probably bother to download heroes of the storm XD

I feel you. I watched a Zed on my team put a Taric from 4000 to 0 with one burst. Taric was at 1000 health at the end but Zed's ult still hadn't triggered. I was thinking "it's not going to kill him", but he popped and Zed walked away knowing it would. 

There is may too much fucking anti-tank in this game. There are like 6 anti-tank items. Liandry's, Ruin King, Black Cleaver, Last Whisper, etc. I did the math and ruin king adds like 300 physical damage to the first few hits vs a 5000 health person. That's fucking ridiculous. 

With Last Whisper, and Black Cleaver you penetration 65% of enemy's armor. Add in runes, masteries, and the flat armor pen you have and that's around 75%. So a 400 armor Malphite will have the equivalent of 100 armor. That's fucking 300 armor, or 4-5 items worth taken care of with 2 items.
And then there is Vayne, who outright nullifies every single item a tank could buy at LEVEL TWO.
Yeah, in the death recap she is dealing more true damage than physical damage.
